did.head: Overview
did.unittitle: Carolyn Caddes papers and photographs, circa 1980-2015
did.abstract: Carolyn Caddes (1935- ) is an American photographer who spent years photographing portraits of famous Californian innovators. Her book, Portraits of Success: Impressions of Silicon Valley Pioneers, focused on Silicon Valley technology visionaries such as Steve Jobs, Robert Noyce and David Packard. She spent many hours with each of her subjects and provided an intimate look into their lives. She also conducted extensive research on her subjects’ companies. Portraits of Success was published in 1986 and Caddes did follow up portraits of these pioneers and other technology pioneers on the rise in the mid-1990s for Nikkei, a Japanese business magazine. In the early 2000s, Caddes began another book project. She interviewed and photographed wine makers in Napa Valley. Although this project never became a book, Caddes conducted hours of personal and professional research as well as photographed some of the major contributors in Napa’s wine industry.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Dept. of Special Collections & University Archives.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research use. Audio-visual materials are not available in original format, and must be reformatted to a digital use copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Carolyn Caddes (1935- ) is an American photographer who spent years photographing portraits of famous Californian innovators. Her book, Portraits of Success: Impressions of Silicon Valley Pioneers, focused on Silicon Valley technology visionaries such as Steve Jobs, Robert Noyce and David Packard. She spent many hours with each of her subjects and provided an intimate look into their lives. She also conducted extensive research on her subjects’ companies. Portraits of Success was published in 1986 and Caddes did follow up portraits of these pioneers and other technology pioneers on the rise in the mid-1990s for Nikkei, a Japanese business magazine.

In the early 2000s, Caddes began another book project. She interviewed and photographed wine makers in Napa Valley. Although this project never became a book, Caddes conducted hours of personal and professional research as well as photographed some of the major players in Napa’s wine industry.

Included in this collection are Caddes’ interviews, portraits, research, correspondence and work files depicting Silicon Valley’s technology industry, California wine makers and Caddes’ personal work.

The materials consist of negative, personal photographs and personal notes. Also includes the following: information about Portraits of Success on exhibition at the de Saisset Musuem, tributes to Amy J. Blue May 21, 1988 and newspaper clippings along with an issue of Update from the American Electronics Association September 1986.

The materials consist of West Magazine from San Jose Mercury News September 21, 1986 with article entitled “Do You Know Me? Face- to- face with Silicon Valley pioneers”. Another West magazine entitled “The 100 Most Powerful People in Silicon Valley” from June 7, 1987 is also included as well as a clipping from Business Week November 25, 1985.

The materials consist of a Times Tribune article on Portraits of Silicon Valley Pioneers exhibit at Green Library at Stanford. November 8, 1986. Also included are articles about Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak, and other Silicon Valley pioneers.

The materials consist of negatives and labels of John Crawford of Intel Corporation.

The materials consist of information pertaining to John Doerr, one of the partners of the venture capitalist firm Kleiner Perkins Caufield and Byers. This folder includes research on the company, a first draft of Caddes’ interview with him and correspondence with Doerr and his family.

The materials consist of negatives, newspaper clippings, interview questions and company research concerning Larry Ellison, CEO of Oracle.

The materials consist of correspondence with Andy Grove, CEO of Intel. This folder also contains newspaper clippings and articles about his battle with prostate cancer. Also included is company information and brochures from Intel’s museum.

The materials consist of correspondence setting up Jobs' portrait session and about the sale of the portrait of Robert Noyce to Jobs.

did.unittitle: The Gates Computer Science Building, Stanford University, 1996

scopecontent.p: The materials consist of slide holders for Peter Drucker. Microcasettes of John Morgridge, Jerry Sanders, Paul Cook, Andy Grove, John Doerr, Sandra Kurtzig, Larry Ellison, Burton McMurtry, Steve Wozniak, John Young, Kenneth Oshman, Ed McCracken, James Clark, James Treybig and Larry Sonsini.

The materials consist of photographs, research and correspondence from Caddes' follow up project to Portraits of Success. She wanted to complete another Portraits of Success book focused on California wine makers. She traveled around Napa Valley between 1992 and 1993 and interviewed some of the most influential wine makers at the time. The book was never published.

The materials consist of correspondence between Carolyn Caddes and Leon Adams, a copy of California Wine Industry Oral History Project. This section is entitled “Leon Adams: California Wine Industry Affairs: Recollections and Opinions”. Also included are negatives, prints and copies from the portait session.

The materials consist of correspondence between Carolyn Caddes and Dr. Maynard Amerine and a copy of California Wine Industry Oral History Project. The section is entitled “The University of California and the State’s Wine Industry” and is an interview conducted by Ruth Teiser. Copyright 1972. Also included are prints and negatives of Amerine’s portrait session with Caddes.

The materials consist of a copy of California Wine Industry Oral History Project entitled “Brother Timothy: The Christian Brothers as Winemakers”. Also included is correspondence between Caddes and Brother Timothy and prints of their portrait session.
The materials consist of business cards from different wineries, photographers and businesses in Napa Valley.
The materials consist of letters written to Chavez and research.
The materials consist of negative, prints, informational brochures on Scramsberg winery, an issue of Food and Wine and correspondence.
The materials consist of correspondence, and a copy of California Wine Industry Oral History Project section entitled “Alfred Fromm: Marketing California Wine and Brandy”.
The materials consist of correspondence, prints and copies of portraits.
The materials consist of clippings about the Gallo family and Napa Valley.
The materials consist of correspodence between Julio Gallo and Caddes and occassionally Lorraine Jones, Julio's assistant.
The materials consist of notes from Caddes' interactions with Julio. Also included are drafts of an article written by Caddes entitled "Julio Gallo: A First and Last Visit".
The materials consist of prints and copies from the portrait session.
The materials consist of correspondence.
The materials consist of correspondence, information about Grgich Hills Cellar and prints and negatives from the portrait session.
The materials consist of clippings, correspondence, winery information and notes.
The materials consist of a letter to Jess Jackson.
The materials consist of negatives, prints, informational brochures about the Louis M. Martini Winery, correspondence and clippings.

The materials consist of correspondence, prints and photographs from portrait session, clippings and a copy of California Wine Industry Oral History Project section entitled “Robert Mondavi: Creativity in the California Wine Industry”.
The materials consist of correspondence to Harold Olmo.

did.unittitle: Portraits of Success: California wine makers book project files

scopecontent.p: The materials consist of notes. correspondence, a book proposal, reciepts and lists for the book project.
The materials consist of clippings on Napa Valley and California wine makers.
The materials consist of correspondence about ideas for a new book about California wine makers.
The materials consist of research notes and preliminary writing on California wine makers.

The materials consist of transparencies of winery where Andre Tchelistcheff consulted in Liguria, Italy. Also included are negatives from portrait session, a copy of California Wine Industry Oral History Project entitled” AndreTchelistcheff: Grapes Wine and Ecology” and information about Beaulieu Vineyard.
The materials consist of information on Sutter Home Winery, their newsletter and gift catalog. Also included is correspondence and photographs.
The materials consist of information about Napa Valley's wine auction.
The materials consist of brochures from Napa Valley's wineries.
The materials consist of lists of California winemakers and their support systems.
The materials consist of information on Stag’s Leap Cellars, newletters, notes, clippings, correspondence, prints and photographs.

The materials consist of additional photography projects that Caddes completed over her career. Also included is research on Silicon Valley potentially in hopes of creating a sequel to Portraits of Success: Impressions of Silicon Valley Pioneers.

The materials consist of clippings, correspondence, maps, receipts and brochures from a trip toBozemna, Montanta. Caddes accompanied Steve Wozniak, his wife at the time and his mother to Bozeman Montana where he was honored at the Computer Museum as a Computer Pioneer alongside with Tim Berners-Lee, inventor of the World Wide Web and Ray Tomlinson, inventor of email.
The materials consist of photographs, notes, correspondence and research regarding a portrait session with Thomas Erlich.
The materials consist of correspondence, notes, clippings and research for a portrait session with Milton Friedman.
The materials consist of "Times to Remember: The Life of Edward L. Ginzton", a manuscript written by Ginzton about his life.
The materials consist of annual reports of Intel, notes, clippings and correspondence.
The materials consist of correspondence, notes, brochures and research.
The materials consist of clippings, correspondence, notes, research and lists for a proposed sequel to Portraits of Success.
The materials consist of photographs and negatives of James Rosse, former provost of Stanford University.
The materials consist of negatives, photographs, correspondence and clippings.

The materials consist of cassettes of interviews, Steve Harris on February 20, 1985 and Barney Oliver on February 22, 1985. Also included is James Joyce's Ulysses read by Robert Polhemus. Also included is a button that reads "Reagan Library- Just Say No!".
The materials consist of construction on campus of the Falk building which is the cardiology building.

The materials consist of photographs and negatives of Tom Peters and David Montgomery teaching at Stanford in 1982 at the Graduate School of Business. They taught at the Executive Program for Smaller Companies. Tom Peters (1942-) is a business management author who wrote In Search of Excellence in 1982. David Montgomery is a professor of marketing at Stanford's Graduate Business School.
The materials consist of brochures, negatives, photographs and correspondence.
The materials consist of negatives and photographs of rooftop of the Shy Building.
